results.name: LeBron 18 “Best 10-18”
results.story: The Nike LeBron 18 “Best 10-18” is a “What The” inspired makeup of LeBron James’s eighteenth signature shoe with Nike Basketball that was released in Spring 2021. As stated in its nickname, the “Best 10-18” edition of the Nike LeBron 18 combines some of the most popular colorways of the models found within the range of the Nike LeBron 10 through the LeBron 18. The upper features a predominantly eye-catching Psychic Purple woven construction with equally vibrant accenting overlays on the tongue and collar. An orange-outlined black Swoosh is embroidered on the toe and a floral motif appears on the sock-like knit collar. LeBron’s signature “crown” branding appears on the semi-translucent teal-colored molded heel counter. A smoky semi-translucent Air unit appears in the heel of the blue speckled white foam midsole.

results.name: Kyrie 7 “Concepts Horus - Special Box”
results.story: The Concepts x Nike Kyrie 7 “Horus” is a special edition collaboration between the Boston based sneaker boutique and Nike Basketball on Kyrie Irving’s seventh signature shoe in a colorway inspired by the ancient Egyptian god. A May 2021 release, the “Horus” channels the energy of previous Concepts x Nike Kyrie collaborations, notably the Egyptian-themed Nike Kyrie 5 and 6. The upper features an attention-grabbing teal mesh construction. An “Eye of the Ra” design appears on the medial side and a gold Swoosh appears on the lateral side of the shoe. Gold “Concepts” embroidery is stitched onto the heel. Dual “Kyrie Irving” and “Concepts” branding can be found on the light blue mesh tongue of the left and right shoe, respectively. An icy blue semi-translucent panel appears on the lateral side of the forefoot of the orange foam midsole. Release date: May 19, 2021.

results.name: SB Dunk Low “Wasted Youth - Special Box”
results.story: The Wasted Youth x Nike SB Dunk Low is a punk-inspired collaboration between streetwear designer Verdy and Nike SB on the low-top skate shoe. Wasted Youth, which precedes the Japanese designer’s Girls Don’t Cry streetwear imprint, was revived for this limited edition colorway of the SB Dunk Low and, true to its nickname, the look is wholly influenced by the rebellious spirit of punk rock. The upper’s washed black denim base features a decidedly pre-worn look with fraying and unfinished edges on each panel. A frayed black tumbled leather Swoosh logo appears on the lateral side and an embroidered red rose motif is incorporated into the design of the Swoosh branding on the medial side. Red contrast stitching can be found on the back of the shoe beneath the silver metallic hoops that are hooked into the leather branding patch on the heel. The slogans “Wasted” and Youth” are embroidered on the back of the left and right shoe, respectively. Verdy and Nike SB add a patchwork-like leather and denim overlay to the forefoot of each shoe. Mismatched white and black Nike SB branding can be found on the right and left tongue tags. Note: This listing is for pairs that include the special limited edition shoe box. Release date: April 6, 2021.

results.name: SB Dunk Low Pro QS “Sean Cliver - Special Box”
results.story: "The Sean Cliver x Nike SB Dunk Low “Holiday Special” is a Holiday 2020 collaboration between StrangeLove Skateboards and Nike SB that’ll add Christmas spirit to your sneaker collection. Please note: This is the listing for the limited edition ""Special Box"" version of the ""Holiday Special."" The “Holiday Special” is the second SB Dunk created in tandem by StrangeLove and Nike SB in 2020, and follows 2012’s “Krampus” Dunk High colorway by Cliver. Here, the upper is outfitted with references to winter, starting with the snowflake inspired supple Ice Blue suede overlays on the forefoot, eyelets, collar, and heel. The theme continues with crisp white leather on the perforated toe and mid-panel. A flashy Metallic Gold leather Swoosh breaks up the look on either side of the shoe and silver lace sits on top a padded light blue suede tongue. Embroidered gold “Nike” detailing is located on the heel. The insole of the right shoe features co-branding in the form of Sean Cliver’s signature and gold Nike SB detailing. The left shoe's insole displays elves making toys. A speckled icy blue outsole adds to the overall festive wintry theme. Release date: December 19, 2020."

results.name: SB Dunk High “Concepts Mallard/Turdunken Special Packaging”
results.story: The Concepts x Nike SB Dunk High “Turdunken” is a limited edition collaboration between the Massachusetts based sneaker boutique and Nike SB on a Dunk for Thanksgiving and the Holidays. This is the listing for the special packaging version of the “Turdunken” SB Dunk that was released exclusively at Concepts. Described by Deon Point, Concepts’ Creative Director, as the “most off-the-wall thing we’ve ever done,” the “Turdunken” is inspired by the popular Holiday dish of stuffing both a chicken and duck inside of a turkey. The design is based on the mallard duck. Overtures to the waterfowl include an iridescent blue and green Swoosh on either side and leather textured to look like feathers on the mid-panel. Suede detailing on the heel mimics duck down. Additional tongue-in-cheek nods to the mallard duck include an orange sole in reference to its legs and feet and a toile print on the insole and collar lining displaying a flock of mallards (and even a lobster or two, as well.) Release date: November 14, 2020.

results.name: SB Dunk Low “StrangeLove - Special Box”
results.story: The StrangeLove Skateboards x Nike SB Dunk Low was designed in collaboration with the underground skate brand to celebrate Valentine’s Day. This listing includes the limited edition packaging, which is inspired by Valentine's Day cards and boxes from the crew's childhood years in elementary school. Holidays have traditionally served as a source of inspiration for Nike SB and their venerable Dunk dating back to the mid-aughts heyday of the shoe. That tradition continues with this premium Dunk Low. Heartwarming hues of pink and red encompass the upper of the low-top Dunk, which include a red velvet Swoosh and light pink velvet overlays on the forefoot and heel. StrangeLove’s logo is embroidered onto the heel, and it also appears on the white nylon tongue tab. A white midsole and translucent pink outsole with red and blue hearts visible underneath completes the unique design.

results.name: Dunk Low Retro “University Red”
results.story: "The Nike Dunk Low “University Red” mirrors the ""St. John’s"" colorway of the original “Be True To Your School Pack” from 1985. Worn on-court by members of the Red Storm college basketball team throughout the mid ‘80s, this “University Red” makeup is part of Nike’s Dunk resurgence of 2020 that includes retroing and remastering some of the rarest colorway of the shoe in its history. White leather forms the base of the upper, appearing on the perforate toe, mid-panel, and collar. Consistent with the original look, University Red leather overlays dot the forefoot, eyelets, and heel. A contrasting red leather Swoosh is located on the mid-panel, and white Nike embroidery detailing can be found on the heel. A white rubber midsole with a bold red outsole completes the look of this nostalgic design. Release date: July 1, 2020."

results.name: Air Max 2 Light “Atmos (Special Box)”
results.story: The atmos x Nike Air Max 2 Light is a special collaboration by the famed Japanese sneaker boutique. atmos received the honor of working on the first-ever retro of this classic Air Max model. A longtime producer of some of the best Air Max colorways, atmos created another hit with this vibrant take on the Air Max 2 Light. atmos went even more wild than usual for the Air Max 2 Light, using a vibrant patched-together upper with the various panels covered in Nike Air logos. The overlays are done in clear plastic to let the colorful panels shine through. A mini Swoosh is added to the Air Max unit in the heel for a final special touch. This limited edition version of the atmos x Nike Air Max 2 Light comes in a special box and released in March 2019.

results.name: Kyrie 6 “Concepts - Khepri - Special Box”
results.story: The Concepts x Nike Kyrie 6 “Khepri” is a Winter 2019 collaboration between the Boston-based boutique and Nike Basketball on Kyrie Irving’s sixth signature shoe. A special limited edition box that was available in limited quantities only at Concepts is included with this listing of the sneaker. The “Khepri” colorway is inspired by Egyptian culture and features distinct details throughout its design. Pastel pink hues are incorporated in the leather and mesh upper with the Swoosh branding hit on the mid-panel taking on a metallic silver appearance. A translucent midfoot strap with Egyptian symbols laid within the shell contrasts the icy hues of the “seeing eye” heel design and blue-based midsole. A light silver leather tongue with Irving’s signature Nike logo completes the look. The Concepts x Nike Kyrie 6 “Khepri” was released on December 31, 2019.

results.name: Zoom Haven 97 “CLOT”
results.story: The CLOT x Nike Zoom Haven 97 “White/Red/Blue” is one of three colorways of the hybrid sneaker designed by Chinese retailer CLOT. The brand combined the upper of two classic models for this limited edition collaboration, mixing the upper of the Zoom Haven with the full-length Air Max sole of the Air Max 97. The cult-classic Zoom Haven received new life with this special construction by CLOT, now cushioned with Air Max instead of its original Zoom Air sole unit. This colorway features a predominantly white mesh and TPU upper with red and blue accents and a gum rubber outsole. The CLOT x Nike Zoom Haven 97 “White/Red/Blue” first released exclusively at CLOT and received a global release at select retailers on May 8, 2019.

results.name: Kyrie 4 “NBA 2K18 Road to 99”
results.story: The Nike Kyrie 4 “NBA 2K18 Road to 99” is a limited edition colorway of Kyrie Irving’s fourth signature shoe with Nike Basketball that was given to the first 200 players who completed the “Road to 99” game mode in NBA 2K18. Appearing in a mismatched pink and green colorway, the “Road to 99” is undoubtedly one of the rarest Nike Kyrie models on the market. As mentioned, pink highlights the lateral side of the left shoe and aqua green comprises the look of the lateral side right shoe. The left shoe features blue on the medial side and the right shoe displays yellow. Both pairs have Swoosh embroidery and “NBA 2K18” branding on the mid-panel and heel, respectively. Graffiti-style text highlights the appearance of both pairs.

results.name: Air Force 1 07 Virgil “Off-White - MoMa”
results.story: "The Off-White x Nike Air Force 1 Low ""MoMA"" is a special edition colorway of the low-top shoe that was released in limited quantities at New York City's Museum of Modern Art in January 2018. After Off-White and Nike's ""The 10"" collection effectively took over the sneaker world in 2017, Virgil Abloh kept the momentum going with this black-based colorway of the Air Force 1 that was released exclusively at the Museum of Modern Art. Like Abloh's previous explorations of the Air Force 1, this version features exposed stitching and foam, an orange tab, and “AIR” printed on the midsole. The Air Force 1 ‘07 Virgil x MoMA sold out almost instantly at the Museum of Modern Art and is now regarded as a work of sneaker art. Please note: this item does not contain the original pair of Off-White x Nike socks that were included with the release."

results.name: Air Foamposite One PRM DB “2013 Release”
results.story: "The Nike Air Foamposite One ""Doernbecher"" is a coveted colorway from the 2013 Doernbecher Freestyle collection. The Doernbecher Freestyle collection is the result of a longstanding partnership between the Portland, Oregon children’s hospital and Nike. Patients at the Doernbecher hospital are given the opportunity to design unique colorways of their favorite sneakers. Few Doernbecher Nikes have been more memorable than this eye-catching Foamposite One by Elijah Diggins. The young patient battled Leukemia, which is now in remission, and created a classic look for the basketball shoe, featuring a bright red and black color palette with an abstract graphic across the upper and a half black, half red outsole."

results.name: Dunk CL Hi Top Men “Sentence Case”
results.story: The Undefeated x Nike Dunk High “Bring Back Pack” is a collaboration between the Los Angeles sneaker boutique and Nike that was re-released in February 2013. Aptly named the “Bring Back Pack,” this all-white Dunk debuted over a decade before Undefeated and Nike brought the colorway back along with a matching Hyperdunk in 2013. Like the original version, the more recent release features a crisp all-white leather upper with tonal Swoosh branding on the mid-panel. The white monochromatic theme extends to the shoelaces and mesh tongue. Classic “Nike” branding is printed in brown text on the nylon tongue tag. Undefeated’s “5 Strike” logo is embroidered in brown on the lateral side of the heel. A white midsole and contrasting gum outsole complete the look of this classic minimalist colorway produced in collaboration between Undefeated and Nike. Release date: February 9, 2013.

results.name: Lebron 9 Low “Arnold Palmer”
results.story: The Nike LeBron 9 Low “Arnold Palmer” also known as the “LeBronald Palmer,” gives a nod to the legendary golfer, Arnold Palmer, on a decidedly tropical vibe for LeBron James’s ninth signature shoe with Nike Basketball. James debuted the colorful style on his Instagram account in July 2012, which soon thereafter created a stir of excitement in the sneaker community. An assortment of tropical-inspired graphics, including palm trees and other foliage, can be found across the shoe’s yellow Hyperfuse upper. An orange Swoosh graces both sides. Teal laces appear over the teal tongue with LeBron’s signature in white script. A printed image of Palmer’s signature cocktail, a mixture of iced tea and lemonade, appears on the insole. An orange-tinted, 360-degree Air bubble in the heel of the midsole completes the look. Please note: this is a sample pair that includes a non-original shoe box.

results.name: Air Max Lebron 7 “Heros Pack”
results.story: "The Nike LeBron 7 “Heroes Pack - Penny” is a special makeup of LeBron James’s seventh signature shoe with Nike from the collection that honors three of LeBron’s heroes, Michael Jordan, Anfernee “Penny” Hardaway, and Deion Sanders. All three ""Heroes Pack"" colorways from 2010 never released at retail and remain only as rare samples to this day. As you could imagine, the “Penny” edition from the “Heroes Pack” salutes Hardaway, the former Orlando Magic guard, with blue accents on a white and black colorway that call to mind the color block of classic Nike Air Penny styles. A Royal Blue Swoosh with black cracking detailing appears on top of the white Flywire mid-panel. Nike constructs the mudguard, eyelets, collar, and heel overlays in a durable black nylon material. LeBron’s signature is found on the Flywire overlay on the tongue. A full-length visible Max Air unit in the white midsole provides a responsive ride on and off the basketball court. Please note: this is a rare sample pair that comes in a damaged box."

results.name: Lebron 7 PE “DJ Clark Kent 112 Pack”
results.story: The DJ Clark Kent x Nike LeBron 7 PE “112 Pack” is a highly limited collaboration between Nike Basketball and Brooklyn’s own DJ Clark Kent on LeBron James's seventh signature shoe. Renowned sneaker collector and early Jay-Z collaborator DJ Clark Kent outfits the coveted colorway with a black synthetic base with intersecting lime green Flywire. A black nubuck mudguard and toe panel, reflective silver paneling, more neon lime accents throughout the upper and sole, and elephant-textured paneling at the collar all complete the striking look of this ultra-rare LeBron 7.

results.name: Lebron 7 PE
results.story: The Nike Air Max LeBron 7 Sample “Box Out Breast Cancer” is a rare sample version of LeBron James’s seventh signature shoe with Nike Basketball in a colorway that raises awareness for breast cancer. From 2009, this hyper-limited edition of the Nike Air Max LeBron 7 appears in a black colorway with a gradient black-to-pink look on the woven mid-panel. A pink Swoosh adorns either side. A glossy black leather mudguard calls to mind the styling of the mudguard found on the Air Jordan 11 “Space Jam.” Underfoot, a three-quarter length visible Air unit provides a responsive ride. Please note: this is an unreleased sample version of the Nike Air Max 7 “Box Out Breast Cancer.”

results.name: Zoom Lebron 4 “NYC Grafitti”
results.story: The Nike LeBron 4 “NYC Graffiti” is an extremely rare colorway of LeBron Jame’s fourth signature design released exclusively via a special LeBron-themed Nike pop up in New York City in 2006. The “NYC Graffiti” edition gets reimagined with a NYC-appropriate touch as light blue graffiti print lines the arching mid portion of the “no midsole” silhouette. Sturdy white Foamposite covers the upper with black nubuck around the ankle strap that features a red outlined white Swoosh placed on top. Further styling includes a red sock-liner, a black pull tab, and red translucent outsole. The highly sought-after Nike LeBron 4 “NYC Graffiti” is one of the the Nike LeBron line's most limited colorways to date.
